newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa stocks end weak as rate cut hopes dwindle.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa stocks end weak as rate cut hopes dwindle.

text.p: South African shares ended Friday firmly down as hopes of an early interest rate cut faded and gold shares also ended soft, but off their day lows, as they ignored a firmer bullion price, dealers said.
Dealers said futures players were directing trade as they cut long positions, putting pressure on equities.
Trade was thin and volatile with only 485 million rand worth of shares trade.
Gold shares refused to ride on bullion's recovery as players were wary of the platinum-inspired rally. Dealers said the market felt the rally was not related to bullion fundamentals.
The market was seen soft next week with occasional bounces after the GDP figure.
The industrial index dropped 77.7 points, or 0.93 percent, to 8,240.2 points, the gold index shed 7.8 points to 1,173.8 points and the all-share index was down 53.0 points to 7,021.7 points.
